name: Life of Pi by Yann Martel – Special Signed Edition
description: These Special Edition signed copies of Life of Pi are printed on 30% Canadian flax straw and 70% post consumer recycled content paper. Your purchase helps to keep Richard Parker and his forest friends' home intact by supporting Canopy's work to protect ancient forests. Canopy’s rare copies of Life of Pi are the only hard cover edition published. Each copy has been signed by Yann Martel and contains a special foreword by the author hailing the promise embodied in these books, which showcase straw paper as a novel way to save our forests and provide Canadian grain farmers with a means of turning harvest leftovers into a commodity. A unique collector’s piece by a well-loved Canadian author, these books make an amazing literary prize or present, not to mention a gift to Canadian heritage: our forests. **Please note that due to the high value of this item, Canopy uses tracked, insured shipping which carries a higher cost. If you don't see your region listed or have questions about the rates, email Laura@canopyplanet.org and we'll be happy to help you find the best shipping solution your order.

name: Dear Life by Alice Munro — Rare Signed Special Edition
description: Only seventy special edition books are available: printed on paper made with 27% wheat straw, 9% Canadian flax straw and 64% post consumer recycled content. What would our Dear Life be like without ancient forests? Alice Munro is the original champion of Canopy’s mission to protect forests. Each one of Canopy's rare, signed copies of Dear Life is numbered, and is a testament to the twelve-year relationship between Canopy and Alice Munro, which started with the Canadian edition of Hateship, Friendship, Courtship, Loveship, Marriage. Munro stopped the presses with these books to ensure they were printed on Ancient Forest Friendly Paper, making them North America’s first major title printed on 100% recycled paper. A unique collector’s piece by a Nobel Prize winner and well-loved Canadian author, these books make an amazing literary prize or present, not to mention a gift to Canadian heritage: our forests. **Please note that due to the high value of this item, Canopy uses tracked, insured shipping which carries a higher cost. If you don't see your region listed or have questions about the rates, email laura@canopyplanet.org and we'll be happy to help you find the best shipping solution your order.

name: Tiger Ecojot Journal
description:
Sumatran tigers are now highly endangered with less than 400 remaining in the wild. This is due to extensive deforestation of their habitat. By purchasing this journal you are supporting Canopy’s work to protect Sumatra’s forests – the wild place these fantastic animals call home.

Ecojot is known for their eye catching journal covers, but what Canopy likes the most is its commitment to protecting habitat by making a sound business choice to print beautiful journals on 100% post consumer recycled paper. Ecojot is doing right by Sumatran Tigers and all the creatures of the Sumatran Rainforest.

The journal is 6 x 8 " (or 15 x 20 cm) and has 80 lined sheets with a perforated edge.  Purchasing the Sumatran Tiger Journal supports Canopy's efforts to protect these precious animals and their habitat.

name: 'Bou ecojot journal
description: Canopy has teamed up with Ecojot and Cascades to produce a memorable journal celebrating the iconic Canadian Boreal Woodland Caribou and recognizing its plight. Woodland Caribou habitat has receded dramatically over the past century due to encroaching development and habitat disturbance. Caribou require large areas of mature, coniferous forest. Forest management practices create a fragmented and diverse forest landscape, placing caribou at considerable risk. Canopy's efforts to protect large tracts of the boreal forest are all about keeping the Woodland Caribou happy. The 'Bou Journal is 6x9" (15x23 cm), and spiral bound with 150 lined sheets. Made from 100% post-consumer waste, Canopy knows this paper is the kind that keeps the conifers in the Boreal Forest standing for the Woodland Caribou. All proceeds go directly to Canopy. Buy an Ecojot 'Bou Journal today!

name: Mini Fronds and Mega Fauna—$200.00 gift to Canopy
description: The understory is just as impressive as a forest canopy. It’s a place for listening carefully, observing with all your senses and imagining the potential of every seed and sapling. A one-time gift of $200.00 allows Canopy the opportunity to make a compelling presentation to a corporate CEO outlining the benefits and possibilities of Second Harvest Paper; which is paper made from straw leftover after the grain harvest. In addition to a 50% lower carbon footprint, Second Harvest Paper helps to stabilize our climate by protecting the massive carbon sinks our forests represent. Photo © Andrew Wright

name: The Canopy—$100.00 gift to Canopy
description: Imagine a birds’ eye view of the Boreal forest on an autumn day. We do everyday. And we think of all the amazing things that forests do. Home to thousands of birds, animals and insect, a perfect water and air filtration system, the best playground ever. A one-time $100.00 gift to Canopy helps us meet with senior executives to educate them on how their company can embed sustainable operations and make purchasing decisions that leave these critical forest ecosystems alone and spare the hawks, eagles, and hundreds of other feathered friends from habitat destruction. Photo © Andrew Wright

name: The Understory—$50.00 gift to Canopy
description:
The majesty of the Pacific Northwest forest is unparalleled.  This precious coastal temperate ecosystem is disappearing fast which puts at risk the mighty Grizzly, rare Kermode bear, and the yellow-bellied sapsuckers that rely on it.

A one-time gift of $50.00 can support Canopy to forward the Great Bear Rainforest Agreement and see it fulfilled by industry and government before the remaining millenial Western Red Cedars; which have a diameter of up to 10 feet and a height of up to 200 feet, are gone forever.

name: Cedars and Hemlocks and Pines. Oh my!—$20 gift to Canopy
description:
Unlike Dorothy's fear of the Emerald Forest and its lions and tigers and bears, we have no fear of these species but do fear for them.  A one time gift of $20.00 can help Canopy in efforts to secure top selling authors as Canopy signatories ensuring that their books are printed using sustainable papers.  

We think L. Frank Baum would have printed The Wonderful Wizard of Oz on Ancient Forest Friendly paper just like J. K. Rowling did when she worked with Canopy to protect Harry Potter’s Forbidden Forest!

name: Canada’s National Parks: A Celebration
description: First published to Celebrate the centennial anniversary of Canada's first National Park, Canada's National Parks: A Celebration is filled with outstanding landscape photography, taken by some of the country's most celebrated photographers, covering all 42 of Canada's national parks. The book also includes a detachable coupon that can be redeemed for a free family day pass at any Parks Canada national park, national historic site or national marine conservation area. Buy one as a gift today and support the conservation of our forests! Canopy is out of stock for this gorgeous coffee table book. If you are interested in hearing when copies will be available, please sign up for our newsletter or email us.
